context_meta.title: Barber goes above the call of duty to ensure child with autism gets amazing haircut
context_meta.summary: Wyatt Lafreniere's mother Fauve told ABC News that her son was diagnosed with autism at 2 years old. "I was nervous the first time," Fauve Lafreniere, 30, said of when she first went to Jakob's vintage barbershop two years ago.

text: There is no pain to compare with what a parent experiences when their child is very sick or dying. I did the rodeo thing when I was a young man and my body has been "broke in the middle and on both ends". But dealing with my own injuries and pain was an easy experience compared to what I experienced when my younger son was dying. He fought like a lion for his life. But he was born with serious heart problems...best doctors and best hospital in the entire world. It was not enough to save him. I can still remember his last haircut. And I kick myself when I do because I did not save a bit of his hair. I think his Mom did...but when he passed it put her health problems into overdrive and she soon followed him to the afterlife. I did not find any of his hair in her stash of "precious memories". It is after 5pm...I'm gonna get something to drink. Maybe I can find something to occupy my mind and stop fretting over stuff I can not change.

text: Frank Schwab is blinded by his leftist, elitist image of himself. Once again, liberal media tries to twist the story to conform our country to their distorted agenda. VP Pence , clearly stated that "everyone is entitled to their opinion", as is he and Trump. If the players wish to violate the rules of the NFL and the relationship with their fans by kneeling during the anthem, let them. IF VP Pence wants to leave an event that allows this in violation of the NFL rules, then he can leave. Millions of NFL fans find distain with the pampered players that choose to protest in this manner, they should not attend the games either. It is their right.
